meanings.definition: To transfer from one ship or mode of transportation to another.
meanings.sent1: The workers will tranship the cargo from the large ship to the smaller boat.
meanings.sent2: The company will tranship the goods from the truck to the train for faster delivery.
meanings.sent3: The pirates tried to tranship the treasure, but ended up dropping it in the ocean!
meanings.sent4: She had to tranship her emotions from fear to courage before giving the speech.
meanings.sent5: The crane operator carefully transhipped the containers, ensuring they arrived safely.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring goods from one vessel to another.
meanings.sent1: The tranship of the supplies was done efficiently by the dock workers.
meanings.sent2: The tranship of the cargo was necessary to load it onto the waiting ship.
meanings.sent3: The tranship of the packages turned into a race between the workers.
meanings.sent4: The tranship of responsibilities between team members was seamless.
meanings.sent5: The tranship of the goods was a sight to behold as the cranes moved swiftly.

meanings.definition: The process of transferring cargo from one vehicle to another.
meanings.sent1: The tranship of the luggage from the bus to the plane was quick.
meanings.sent2: The tranship of the products from the truck to the warehouse was completed in no time.
meanings.sent3: The tranship of the items became a fun challenge for the workers.
meanings.sent4: The tranship of knowledge from one generation to the next is crucial.
meanings.sent5: The tranship of the cargo was like a dance between the vehicles, perfectly coordinated.
